answers.answer:
The Red Cross offers free medical consultations with various specialists, access to medical services like ultrasound and ECG, and psychological support for refugees in Bucharest. They also provide translation assistance to facilitate communication with doctors.

You can find detailed information by visiting the Red Cross Romania website at https://dopomoha.ro/en/health-promotion-center and reading the content under the 'Health Promotion Center' section.

answers.answer:
Yes, free medical consultations are available for Ukrainian refugees in Bucharest at the Health Promotion Center opened by Red Cross Romania. Specialists in various fields offer consultations, along with some medical services and psychological support.

You can find more detailed information by visiting the Red Cross Romania website: https://dopomoha.ro/en/health-promotion-center.

answers.answer:
The Health Promotion Center offers consultations with a pediatrician, cardiologist, diabetologist, ophthalmologist, and dentist. They also provide psychological support.

To find this detailed information, please visit the Red Cross Romania website at https://dopomoha.ro/en/health-promotion-center and read under the section titled "Health Promotion Center - free medical care for refugees from Ukraine."

answers.answer:
Appointments for medical care can be made by calling 0747 278 486 or 0748 185 714. Calls can be made in Romanian, Russian, Ukrainian, or English.

You can find this detailed information on the Red Cross Romania website, dopomoha.ro, by navigating to the 'Health Promotion Center' section.

answers.answer:
The Red Cross Health Promotion Center in Bucharest operates Monday to Friday from 10:00 to 18:00.

To find this detailed information on the webpage, please visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/health-promotion-center and look under the section titled "Health Promotion Center" or search for "Working hours".
